___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___Company.description: Company to which remittance should be sent.

$eref.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

___directBill_ID.description: Identifier for the organization to be billed directly for travel services.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the payment form.

___guaranteeID.description: Provides the identifier as specified by the GuaranteeTypeCode (e.g., Corporate ID or IATA number).

___paymentTransactionTypeCode.description: This is used to indicate either a charge, reserve (deposit) or refund.

___guaranteeIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates this represents a guarantee rather than a payment form.

___costCenterID.description: A reference to identify the billing department for allocating cost of travel to company account.

___guaranteeTypeCode.description: Used to specify the method of guarantee. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Payment Type (PMT).

Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

___Number.description: May contain the street number and optionally the street name.

___Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

___City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

___Address.description: The address of the Billing Account for which the voucher has been issued.

$eref.description: A form of payment using a voucher or coupon.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___valueType.description: Defines the type of voucher (e.g., full credit or partial credit).

___expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

___supplierIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of the electronic voucher, created by the supplier.

___seriesCode.description: Identification of a series of coupons or vouchers identified by serial number(s).

___billingNumber.description: Reference of the billing account which handles the payment transaction.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___groupDaysApplyInd.description: When true, specifies the Group Days Apply Value can be used for this Voucher Billing Account.  This indicator is used to allow the usage of a car rental days voucher when part of an inclusive tour.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___electronicIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates the voucher is electronic. An E-voucher is a value document issued by the Travel Agent for the customer. The e-voucher can be used as a proof of reservation, but more normally, as a full-payment or partial payment.

___identifier.description: Unique identifier of the electronic voucher.

___Voucher.description: A form of payment using a voucher or coupon.

___CardCode.description: Card code association such as VI for Visa, MC for Mastercard or AX for American Express, etc.

___secureInd.description: If true, all or a portion of this data is secure, via tokenization, encryption and/or masking.

___CardNumber.description: Credit card number embossed on the card.

___id.description: XML ID only for use within the document.

___language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

___type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

___Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

___Person_Name.description: Description: The details of the Card Holder's Name.

$eref.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

$eref.description: Electronic email addresses, in IETF specified format.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the e-mail address.

___defaultInd.description: If true, this identifies this is the default email address.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___emailType.description: Defines the purpose of the e-mail address (e.g. personal, business, listserve). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Email Address Type (EAT).

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

___validInd.description: If true, this is a valid email address that has been system verified via a successful email transmission.

$eref.description: Program rewarding frequent use by accumulating credits for services provided by vendors.

___primaryLoyaltyIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates this is the primary customer loyalty program and when false, indicates this is not the primary customer loyalty program.

___membershipID.description: Unique identifier of the member in the program (membership number, account number, etc.).

___loyalLevel.description: Indicates special privileges in program assigned to individual.

___SignupDate.description: Indicates when the member signed up for the loyalty program.

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

___allianceLoyaltyLevelName.description: Name of the alliance loyalty level (e.g.,OneWorld  uses Emerald, Ruby, etc and SkyTeam uses Elite, etc.)

___loyalLevelCode.description: Provides a numeric code assigned to a particular loyalty level.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

___programID.description: Identifier to indicate the company owner of the loyalty program.

___expireDateExclusiveIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

___vendorCode.description: Indicate the partner(s)/vendor(s) for which the customer loyalty number is valid.

___customerType.description: Original assessment of the customer by the travel agent.

___password.description: The password for the member in the program.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

___singleVendorInd.description: Indicates if program is affiliated with a group of related offers accumulating credits.

___travelSector.description: Identifies the travel sector. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Travel Sector (TVS).

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

___customerValue.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer (e.g., VIP, numerical ranking).

___id.description: A reference placeholder for this loyalty membership.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

$eref.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

___areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

___phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

___extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

___id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

$eref.description: ISO 2 char country code  - Preferred country code is the 2 character country code as defined in ISO 3166-1

___authenticationMethod.description: Specifies the method that was used to authenticate the card.

___encryptionMethod.description: OpenTravel Best Practice: Encryption Method: When using the OpenTravel Encryption element, it is RECOMMENDED that all trading partners be informed of all encryption methods being used in advance of implementation to ensure message processing compatibility.

$eref.description: The error in textual format.

___language.description: The language in which the error is returned.

___shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

___code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Error Codes (ERR).

___recordID.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

___DocURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

___nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

___tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

___Warning.description: Identifies an error that occurred in the processing of the payment card.

___encryptionKeyMethod.description: Developer: This contains a reference to the key generation method being used - this is NOT the key value.

___encryptionKey.description: Note: This contains a key required to retrieve the full payment instrument details compliant with PCI DSS standards.

_88CustomerLoyalty.description: Program rewarding frequent use by accumulating credits for services provided by vendors.

___primaryLoyaltyIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates this is the primary customer loyalty program and when false, indicates this is not the primary customer loyalty program.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___membershipID.description: Unique identifier of the member in the program (membership number, account number, etc.).

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___loyalLevel.description: Indicates special privileges in program assigned to individual.

___SignupDate.description: Indicates when the member signed up for the loyalty program.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

___optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___allianceLoyaltyLevelName.description: Name of the alliance loyalty level (e.g.,OneWorld  uses Emerald, Ruby, etc and SkyTeam uses Elite, etc.)

___loyalLevelCode.description: Provides a numeric code assigned to a particular loyalty level.

___shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___programID.description: Identifier to indicate the company owner of the loyalty program.

___expireDateExclusiveIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___vendorCode.description: Indicate the partner(s)/vendor(s) for which the customer loyalty number is valid.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___customerType.description: Original assessment of the customer by the travel agent.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___password.description: The password for the member in the program.

___optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

$eref.description: Indicates if program is affiliated with a group of related offers accumulating credits.

___singleVendorInd.description: Indicates if program is affiliated with a group of related offers accumulating credits.

$eref.description: Used for codes in the OpenTravel Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 1001, 101.EQP, 1001.EQP or 1001.EQP.X.

___travelSector.description: Identifies the travel sector. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Travel Sector (TVS).

___optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___customerValue.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer (e.g., VIP, numerical ranking).

___id.description: A reference placeholder for this loyalty membership.

___shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

_88Voucher.description: A form of payment using a voucher or coupon.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___valueType.description: Defines the type of voucher (e.g., full credit or partial credit).

___expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

___supplierIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of the electronic voucher, created by the supplier.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___seriesCode.description: Identification of a series of coupons or vouchers identified by serial number(s).

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___billingNumber.description: Reference of the billing account which handles the payment transaction.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___groupDaysApplyInd.description: When true, specifies the Group Days Apply Value can be used for this Voucher Billing Account.  This indicator is used to allow the usage of a car rental days voucher when part of an inclusive tour.

$eref.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___electronicIndicatorInd.description: When true, indicates the voucher is electronic. An E-voucher is a value document issued by the Travel Agent for the customer. The e-voucher can be used as a proof of reservation, but more normally, as a full-payment or partial payment.

___identifier.description: Unique identifier of the electronic voucher.

_88OriginalIssueAttributes.description: Provides information about the original document on which the reissue is based.

___checkInhibitor.description: When present, indicates that the check digit of the ticket number or the interline agreement do not need to be checked.

$eref.description: Gives the coupon numbers of the ticket, which will be taken for payment.

___coupons.description: Gives a list of references to coupon numbers of the ticket which will be taken for payment.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___issueIATA.description: IATA office number, which issued original ticket.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___issuePlace.description: Place where the original ticket was issued.

$eref.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

___paymentForm.description: Payment type for the original ticket.

___ticketNumber.description: The original ticket number in a series if reissuances.

___issueDate.description: Date when the original ticket was issued.
